1.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy)
Seir, a mountain of Idumaea and its aboriginal occupants, also one in Palestine
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
abundance (in number), i.e. (specifically) a myriad (whether definite or indefinite)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

3.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, to hide (as in the bosom), i.e. to cherish (with affection)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

4.brief: a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch

5.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jeshurun, a symbolic name for Israel
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to test; by implication, to attempt

properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
